content.description: Start with a small bulge at about chest height.  Climb the nice plate like hand holds up and over the small bulge.  From here climb just about straight up to the finish.  Exit left and down climb back to safety.  Nice line.
content.location: The problem is located on the left (West) most side of the wall.

content.description:
Start in just about the middle of the wall.  Climb over another small bulge and follow the middle crack seam to the finish.  Exit by traversing left and down climbing to safety!!  Best line on the wall!!  Should not be missed.

Many variations can be done from the middle point in the wall that are really enjoyable.  Go give it a try!!!
content.location: From the 1st parking lot follow the Sisters Trail for a few hundred yards or until you come to the Ponderosa Trail junction just below and to the EAST of the "Brothers Lookout" formation.  Turn west (Left) onto the Ponderosa Trail for about 30-50 yards before you began to head NORTH (right) up the steeping slope.  Try to stay as EAST as you can so you enter the 2nd Tier gully at a gradual pace.  The "Brother-In-Law Wall" is located up (West) and right past an obvious mini cave called the "Brothers Under Belly Cave."  Walk about 20 feet past the cave and the "Brother-In-Law Wall will come into view.  Enjoy

content.description: Start on the right (East) side of the wall.  Work your left up onto an ok crimp and move your feet up high onto a small self.  Balance is key for this move!!  Reach all the way up a mostly blank face to better holds above.  For shorter people intermediate holds can be found and used.  Fun line marred by an awful landing!!!  The hardest problem on the wall it seems, but if you feel safe it's definitely worth a run!!
content.protection: Pads and good spotters!!!  Bad landing!!
